document.title: Pennsylvania Assessment Anchors and Eligible Content

2C9D265616E14348872A928B1B90DF59.description: Provide a concluding section that follows from the analysis presented.

702C1F006D1F4713B1EA3A9DE0035157.description: Establish and maintain a formal style.

F8F69371C2BA4F679640D1A1C0748715.description: Use precise language and domain-specific vocabulary to inform about or explain the topic and/or convey the experience and events.

5177E19AA0014077A3E16CB08B97563C.description: Use appropriate transitions to clarify the relationships among ideas and concepts.

1EC573070B5D43B4A54755A075481CF7.description: Develop the analysis using relevant evidence from text(s) to support claims, opinions, ideas, and inferences and demonstrating an understanding of the text(s).

50023D7724D84879B01DA4CEC70C25D5.description: Introduce text(s) for the intended audience, state an opinion and/or topic, establish a situation, and create an organizational structure in which ideas are logically grouped to support the writer’s purpose.

C21EE6A5AD5A42AAA7B63A270BF59E26.description: Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and/or research.

122EA90C2F3E47FC91536735CEE99962.description: Choose words and phrases for effect.*

9C739203BB4E4DCDA6AE1816FD1C5944.description: Choose words and phrases to convey ideas precisely.*

A9C0C379E5FB419396A54C74E040A6B9.description: Maintain consistency in style and tone.*

8BFB2E661BD6442C81747FAD640AAD29.description: Vary sentence patterns for meaning, reader/listener interest, and style.*

BCCB4AA03F2E4170B203F2D7977A09EF.description: Use punctuation to separate items in a series.*

F5189613A9E94A0586405B64B5FCFA09.description: Use punctuation (e.g., commas, parentheses, dashes) to set off nonrestrictive/parenthetical elements.*

B6008208BBFB4D1D81CE7DF4A43050C1.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling.

33EA997A2AF448B5A6D7D1F74D2C3459.description: Correctly use frequently confused words (e.g., to, too, two; there, their, they’re).*

F390DC4D68694514AFBCED371F41E27D.description: Produce complete sentences, recognizing and correcting inappropriate fragments and run-on sentences.*

B90C1766A8314B23BB3207FA2524EE6B.description: Recognize and correct inappropriate shifts in verb tense.*

9DC70AC0747E4E7EB1CF3324928D7D06.description: Recognize and correct vague pronouns (i.e., ones with unclear or ambiguous antecedents).*

FABA629217E84A559036320EA4E96E2B.description:
Recognize and correct inappropriate shifts in
pronoun number and person.*

DBC3E027AAD846BFB78D0811F10B7A6C.description: Ensure that pronouns are in the proper case (i.e., subjective, objective, and possessive).

463E09D8CC354813BF60745B0752852D.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage.

43EBE3F6B8E64E5BB2567084698E51E4.description: Provide a conclusion that follows from the narrated experiences or events.

DC1BF2BBDCD0414A80B64B40E48157BA.description: Use precise words and phrases, relevant descriptive details, and sensory language to convey experiences and events.

A3434E07039D405396B96361D11EDD7E.description: Use a variety of transitional words, phrases, and clauses to convey sequence and to signal shifts from one time frame or setting to another.

E0A694688C334B9DAB0FCAC5E2B19AA3.description: Use narrative techniques, such as dialogue, pacing, and description, to develop experiences, events, and/or characters.

142B4E4C9092427A85AF2D1F5C5F9734.description: Engage and orient the reader by establishing a context and point of view and introducing a narrator and/or characters; organize an event sequence that unfolds naturally and logically to support the writer’s purpose.

B55742AB001445D2A6880BCC8778802A.description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective techniques, relevant descriptive details, and well-structured event sequences

82FB2C6425D84F039C719188DA4E6850.description:
Provide a concluding section that follows from the
information or explanation presented.

3366CE23FAE243B7AF03F8B687283EEF.description: Establish and maintain a formal style.

FD2B0719F2E24D7A8B64B17D772BA8E0.description: Use precise language and domain-specific vocabulary to inform about or explain the topic.

4C286D247FE941868A3DB86E88F549FC.description: Use appropriate transitions to clarify the relationships among ideas and concepts.

044F437695C34BA890F78B5E7A04FF2A.description: Develop the topic with relevant facts, definitions, concrete details, quotations, or other information and examples.

B45AC54113514D1A9046B40955D20B47.description: Introduce a topic for the intended audience; organize ideas, concepts, and information using strategies such as definition, classification, compare/contrast, and cause/effect to support the writer’s purpose.

22B486AB3CD6423B939287C9B0093E30.description: Write informative/explanatory texts to examine a topic and convey ideas, concepts, and information through the selection, organization, and analysis of relevant content.

248D609ABB2B49B3ABE632914456A6CE.description:
Provide a concluding section that reinforces the
claims and reasons presented.

80FF0CC2C7FA4BE1A164DCADF5E07FE5.description: Establish and maintain a formal style.

BFD66385FC3D402F807AAAE8628BF54D.description: Use words, phrases, and clauses to clarify the relationships among claim(s) and reasons.

2824D99B276B424CB9CDE91854178404.description: Support claim(s) with clear reasons and relevant evidence, using credible sources and demonstrating an understanding of the topic or text.

BF54E97D978F4CD989404851E0CB6B99.description: Introduce claim(s) for the intended audience and support the writer’s purpose by organizing the reasons and evidence.

EC559A9144894C1599A88D18C7E02ABF.description: Write arguments to support claims with clear reasons and relevant evidence.

EAAECB830F95492897CEC99503B1AD46.description:
Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word meanings.
a. Interpret figurative language (simile, metaphor, personification, and hyperbole) in context.
b. Use the relationship between particular words (e.g., cause/effect, part/whole, item/category, synonym/antonym) to better understand each of the words.
c. Distinguish among the connotations (associations) of words with similar denotations (definitions) (e.g., stingy, scrimping, economical, unwasteful, thrifty).

EBC63A5288BE498E9B0E2617258766D5.description:
Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on grade 6 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range of strategies.
a. Use context (e.g., the overall meaning of a sentence or paragraph, a word’s position or function in a sentence) as a clue to the meaning of a word or phrase.
b. Use common, grade-appropriate Greek or Latin affixes and roots as clues to the meaning of a word (e.g., audience, auditory, audible).
c. Determine the meaning of technical words and phrases used in a text.

17135BD19B814FC7B70814115E7F2AA3.description: Demonstrate understanding of vocabulary and figurative language in informational texts.

E10E5E8A9A824281AB119B0F07F3F3AC.description: Compare and contrast one author’s presentation of events with that of another (e.g., a memoir written by and a biography on the same person).

0BA806F134DA4760A8ACFAF82498B586.description: Trace and evaluate the argument and specific claims in a text, distinguishing claims that are supported by reasons and evidence from claims that are not (e.g., fact/opinion, bias).

E4762528C7F94D75BF13FFB953915355.description: Demonstrate understanding of connections within and/or among informational texts.

83476F59CE6840E5B25461E9D55F989A.description: Determine how the author uses the meaning of words or phrases, including figurative, connotative, or technical meanings, in a text.

471FF082E92640F9B16E7CF67EB0C9B7.description: Analyze how a particular sentence, paragraph, chapter, section, or text feature fits into the overall structure of a text and contributes to the development of the ideas.

3A6FA3868F6F45AC9253F582153B0D77.description: Determine an author’s point of view or purpose in a text and explain how it is conveyed in the text.

5BC233E862504E2F8529E8A8A7F5D963.description: Demonstrate understanding of connections within, between, and/or among informational texts.

871D62E98171496ABAFDFCAEF4E03695.description: Analyze in detail how a key individual, event, or idea is introduced, illustrated, or elaborated in a text (e.g., through examples, anecdotes, or sequence of steps).

4646E5A31CC844FBBBECE87CFB45959A.description: Determine a central idea of a text and how it is conveyed through relevant details; provide a summary of the text distinct from personal opinions or judgments.

69EF4AAEAD4748DB9B018E2058303A63.description: Cite textual evidence to support analysis of what the text says explicitly as well as inferences and/or generalizations drawn from the text.

E2AC89B08B594679ACC232AF796667E8.description: Demonstrate understanding of key ideas and details in informational texts.

F8D668D60E584D2CB792E4B300698C66.description:
Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word meanings.
a. Interpret figurative language (simile, metaphor, personification, and hyperbole) in context.
b. Use the relationship between particular words (e.g., cause/effect, part/whole, item/category, synonym/antonym) to better understand each of the words.
c. Distinguish among the connotations (associations) of words with similar denotations (definitions) (e.g., stingy, scrimping, economical, unwasteful, thrifty).

7D6792AD4961464DB9DFEE8DA219F883.description:
Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on grade 6 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range of strategies. a. Use context (e.g., the overall meaning of a sentence or paragraph; a word’s position or function in a sentence) as a clue to the meaning of a word or phrase.
b. Use common, grade-appropriate Greek or Latin affixes and roots as clues to the meaning of a word (e.g., audience, auditory, audible).

7529BDAC23BA45BF8107D1017BEEA8FD.description: Demonstrate understanding of vocabulary and figurative language in literature

15E06620CEA24398A13B5F4F83CEA169.description: Compare and contrast texts in different forms or genres (e.g., stories, dramas, poems, historical novels, fantasy stories) in terms of their approaches to similar themes and topics.

AF862824989147718D6A0EAC51F880DD.description: Demonstrate understanding of connections within, between, and/or among texts.

9977D5957C184DC19D0C69E5DF1D43D0.description: Determine how the author uses the meaning of words or phrases, including figurative and connotative meanings, in a text; analyze the impact of a specific word choice on meaning and tone.

C48475A6971146FCB832CB1484CCA486.description: Analyze how a particular sentence, chapter, scene, or stanza fits into the overall structure of a text and contributes to the development of the theme, setting, or plot.

5B1D4043C4454F71AD3B051EA4ECF635.description: Determine an author’s purpose in a text and explain how it is conveyed in the text; explain how an author develops the point of view of the narrator or speaker in a text; describe the effectiveness of the point of view used by the author.

419F035F19EC41ED902D8B31B3131632.description: Demonstrate understanding of craft and structure in literature.

76C1E1DD5E284AB596CE149BF14B2AC5.description: Describe how the plot of a particular story, drama, or poem unfolds, as well as how the characters respond or change as the plot moves toward a resolution.

9444D80DA71A4A68909BCE7C8775C31D.description: Determine a theme or central idea of a text and how it is conveyed through relevant details; provide a summary of the text distinct from personal opinions or judgments.

AC0CC01B8556400BA9BC35A32A4115A3.description: Cite textual evidence to support analysis of what the text says explicitly as well as inferences and/or generalizations drawn from the text.

0556F87F45C9451DB12EC9F7705D0433.description: Demonstrate understanding of key ideas and details in literature.
